title.bibl: Onze Toekomst, Nov. 18, 1910. The Spending of Money for Different Purposes

div.bibl: Onze Toekomst, Nov. 18, 1910. THE SPENDING OF MONEY FOR DIFFERENT PURPOSES

body.p: The Women's Benefit Society of the First Christian Reformed Congregation of Englewood has spent this year one hundred and eighty dollars for charitable purposes, namely: Twenty-five dollars for the Medical Missions amongst the Indians; twenty-five dollars for the Home Missions; twenty-five dollars for the Sanitarium for Tuberculosis at Denver, Colorado; twenty-five dollars for the Jewish Missions; twenty-five dollars for the Christian School, and fifty-five dollars for the improvement and lighting of their church building.
